availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. Mannen (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and post master)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and post master. North Carolina native. Married Mary "Polly" Leet Mannen in Warren County on January 29, 1824. Father of Joseph Mannen and Erwin Mannen. Farmer in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Justice of the Peace in Warren County from 1859 to 1860. Postmaster for Graham in Warren County from April 27, 1860 to December 20, 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Warren County from August 1861.

ab.bibl:

Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Warren County, Kentucky, vol. 28, p. 170.
KYR-0001-017-0184.
